passages.text: August 31, 2025 06:34 PM GMT
Titagarh Rail Systems Ltd (TITG.NS) Price Target

A solid proxy to invest in India's rail segment, Titagarh has a strong order book, large addressable passenger coach market, benign competitive environment, steady freight business, and it is building more rail equipment engineering capabilities.
Freight: Expect average monthly execution of 773 wagons in F26e Passenger: Expect execution of 120 coaches in F26e Forecast earnings CAGR F26- 28e: \(24\%\)

Freight business: Titagarh's order book, at 10,772 wagons as of Q1 (largely through Indian Railways/IR), implies revenue visibility of 12 months. A wheelset supply shortage at IR has hampered execution, thereby affecting freight revenue in the interim. Management cited normalization of wheelset issues from Q2F26 onwards, and it expects wagon ordering, which has been subdued, to pick up by Q4F26.

Passenger business: Execution slipped at Bengaluru (189 coaches) in Q1, and management expects this to ramp up in 2H. Further, we expect Gujarat metro to commence execution from Q3F26 onward, and the recent win of Mumbai Line 6 (108 coaches) and Pune - II are slated to commence from Q3F27/ Q1F28, respectively. Titagarh is also the lowest bidder (L1) for Mumbai Line 5 (link), where a firm order for 132 coaches is yet to be placed. As there have been design configuration changes for Vande Bharat, from 16- coach to 24- coach train configuration at the behest of IR, we have pushed out the expected delivery of the first train, from June 25 to Mar- 26 (1,280 coaches), in line with guidance. We assume execution of 126, 304 & 392 coaches in F26, F27 & F28e, implying passenger contribution to EBIT rises from 3% in F25 to 4.0% in F28e.

What's changed: 1) We revised our earnings estimates by - 27%, - 9% and +2% for F26e- F27e & F28e, respectively, to reflect slower execution in the freight segment (inadequate wheelset supply from IR); and b) delayed expected delivery commencement of Vande Bharat coaches, and also new metro coach orders (Mumbai Line 5 & 6). Freight is a larger business (82% of F26e EBIT), and hence EPS sensitivity is higher on EPS F26- 28e. 2) We forecast a 24% EPS CAGR, F26- 28e. Our revised PT is Rs1,017 (previously: Rs1,027), which implies 23% upside; the stock trades at 26x F27e. Our valuation methodology (30x PER on Sept 2027) remains unchanged. We also incorporate preferential equity issuance to promoters.
MORGAN STANLEY INDIA COMPANY PRIVATE LIMITED+
Girish Achhipalia Equity Analyst
Titagarh Rail Systems Ltd (TITG.NS, TITAGARH IN)
India Industrials | India

Long- term outlook intact: The railway budget is maintained at the Rs2.65trn mark in F26e, with physical targets for wagons and coaches increasing \(27\%\) and \(20\%\) , respectively. This indicates encouraging long- term prospects for rolling stock companies.
Strong prospect pipeline: In the recent Union Budget, the minister for railways highlighted a robust outlook:

- 200 new Vande Bharat trains, 100 Amrit Bharat trains, 50 Namo Bharat rapid rail, and 17,500 general non-AC coaches are to be delivered over the next two to three years.- Freight volumes: Targeting Rs1.6bn tonnes by F26e, with continued demand for wagons.- Capex allocation of \(\sim \mathrm{Rs}4.6\mathrm{trn}\) towards new projects and \(\sim 1.16\mathrm{trn}\) towards safety and components through various initiatives.- 7,000-km high-speed rail network capable of supporting speeds of up to \(250\mathrm{km / h}\) by 2047.

In addition, over a longer horizon, metros present strong rolling stock opportunities (as highlighted in the exhibit below) and our bottom up analysis (covering 40 cities) suggest India's metro capacity will likely grow 4.5x over the next few years including approved and proposed projects.
Exhibit 1: Rolling stock opportunity pipeline

Sr. NoProjectUnitsValue (Rs. Crs.)Expected Tender Timeline1Metro Coach Contracts~1318~15,800September' 25 to December' 262Vande Bharat Coach (Aluminium &amp; SS)~3500~72,000December' 253Vande Metro Sub-urban Rakes~2856~19000August '25 to October '254Propulsion Systems~400~2000September '25 to December' 255Traction Motors~2000~280August '25 to December ' 25

Exhibit 2: Physical targets - wagons: 27% increase for F26e
Source: Budget document
Exhibit 3: Physical targets - coaches: 19% increase YoY for F26e
Source: Budget document

Titagarh is adding to its capabilities: Titagarh focuses on strengthening its engineering capabilities. It aims to nearly double its capability in metro product variants (from 22 to 41); for propulsion, it has a strategic intent to triple its offering (from 10 to 31 variants). These are to be developed from F27e onward, with an objective to offer a complete product range and leverage opportunities in domestic as well as exports. Given Indian Railways' focus on rail safety and signaling, Titagarh is setting up a new vertical, and it has identified three key areas - viz., safety, signaling, systems (SSS), and engineering capabilities (train control, asset condition monitoring, vehicular and train mounted solutions). Given limited competition (in passenger coaches) at this juncture, with the industry dominated by Alstom, BEML, and Titagarh, we believe Titagarh remains well placed to tap opportunities supported by strong rolling stock capex.
Exhibit 4: Titagarh: Engineering plan for metro product variants

Source: Company data

Valuation and PT: We revise our earnings estimates by - 27%, - 9% and +2% for F26e, F27e and F28e, respectively, to reflect slower execution in both the freight (inadequate wheelset supply) and passenger (Bangalore, Vande Bharat and Gujarat metro projects) segments. Our revised SOTP stands at Rs1,017 (previously: Rs1,027) owing to our earnings estimate change. We continue to assign a target P/E multiple for Titagarh at 30x (unchanged), and we roll forward our valuation to September 2027.
Proxy for growth in India's railways; OW
Key: - Historical Stock Performance Current Stock Price Price Target
Source: Refinitiv, Morgan Stanley Research

We believe Titagarh is a key beneficiary of the rail theme in India, given its comprehensive offerings (freight & passenger rolling stock), industrial manufacturing, and execution capabilities. However, ordering so far remains subdued. Near- term execution challenges affect the near- term revenue trajectory. We remain OW given the large addressable market, limited private competition at this juncture, and Titagarh's strong engineering capabilities.
Source: Refinitiv, Morgan Stanley Research
Pricing Power: Positive View descriptions of Risk Rewards Themes here

We expect: 1) Freight segment: 7% revenue CAGR over F25- 28e with segment margins at 12.8% (average F26- 28e); 2) Passenger segment: 14.5% revenue CAGR (low base) over F25- 28e and segment EBIT margins to improve from 6% in F25 to 9.3% in F28e; and (3) 29% overall earnings CAGR over F25- 28e.

We expect: 1) Freight segment: 4% revenue CAGR over F25- 28e with segment margins at 12.1% (average F26- 28e); 2) Passenger segment: 14.0% revenue CAGR (low base) over F25- 28e and segment EBIT margins to improve from 6% in F25 to 9.1% in F28e; and (3) 24% overall earnings CAGR over F25- 28e.

We expect: 1) Freight segment: Flat revenue CAGR over F25- 28e with segment margins at 10.6% (average F26- 28e); 2) Passenger segment: 135% revenue CAGR over F25- 28e and segment EBIT margins to improve from 6% in F25 to 8.1% in F28e; and (3) 14% overall earnings CAGR over F25- 28e.

Due to rounding off of decimals, the percentages provided in the % of total' column may not add up to exactly 100 percent.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

In-Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia -relevant MSCI country index or MSCI sub-regional index or MSCI AC Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.

Accordingly, investors should regard those fixed income research reports as providing stand-alone analysis and should not expect continuing analysis or additional reports relating to such issuers and/or individual fixed income products.
